description.narrative: The specialized criminal justice system has developed its normative framework (legislation, policies, socio-educational model) and staff's capacities to implement social-educational models and social reintegration of adolescents in conflict with the law, guided by a focus on children's rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The specialized criminal justice system has developed its normative framework (legislation, policies, socio-educational model) and staff's capacities to implement social-educational models and social reintegration of adolescents in conflict with the law, guided by a focus on children's rights.

description.narrative: The rate of adolescents sentenced to custodial measures under the juvenile justice system was reduced from 48 per 100,000 adolescents in 2017 to 21 per 100,000 adolescents in October 2019. UNICEF has worked with justice system operators to improve interaction, response and case management for 1,851 children and adolescents, coordinating interventions with local, municipal and national institutions to guarantee comprehensive care within a child protection systems approach, promoting a restorative justice approach and favouring non-custodial measures when possible. A final draft for the national policy on juvenile justice is ready and expected to be approved and implemented as of 2020. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2020
